content.description: Several slab lines up a sandy block. Far left line is probably the trickiest, and also the shortest. None are harder than V2.
content.location:
in the flattish fields between Aggie Blvd and Hidden Valley trailhead. Best approached from Hidden Valley trailhead. Several other decent blocs along the way.

38°32'11.2"N 109°31'16.4"W

content.description: Stand start with a sharp little notch in the slippery arete on the right side of the boulder. Layback, pinch, and heel hook your way up the arete. A jug at the apex of the big triangle allows for an easy topout. Lower, harder starts are possible. Best problem on the boulder.
content.location:
Between Hidden Valley trailhead and Aggie Blvd. Follow a wash and boulder hop (avoiding the crust) up hill from the Pipe Dream trail.

38°32'10.7"N 109°31'31.0"W

content.description: Sit start with a neat little dishy hold and a juggy heelhook, then make some strenuous sloper moves (crux) to land on a jug rail. You can either mantle out there, or do a couple more slopey moves to a juggy topout....similar difficulty either way.
content.location:
Park at the hidden valley trailhead and walk the jeep road about 700 feet. Boulder will be near the road on your right.

38°31'59.70"N 109°31'6.99"W
